title: He’s = He Is Or He Has

exercises.title: He's = He Is Or He Has

questions.question: He's already arrived.
questions.description: He's can mean he is or he has. Here it means ‘he has’.

questions.question: It's raining.
questions.description: It’s can mean it is or it has. Here it means ‘it is.’

questions.question: She's preparing for her exam.
questions.description: She’s can mean she is or she has. Here it means ‘she is’.

questions.question: There's a problem with my phone.
questions.description: There’s can mean ‘there is’ or ‘there has’. Here it means ‘there is.’

questions.question: He's arriving in the afternoon.
questions.description: He’s can mean ‘he is’ or ‘he has’. Here it means ‘he is.’

questions.question: He's received the report.
questions.description: He’s can mean he has or he is. Here it means he has.

questions.question: It's no longer important.
questions.description: It’s can mean it is or it has. Here it means it is.

questions.question: He's finished working on the project.
questions.description: He’s can mean he is or he has. Here it means he has.

questions.question: There's been an explosion near the temple.
questions.description: There’s can mean there is or there has. Here it means there has.

questions.question: He's been living here for sixty years.
questions.description: He’s can mean he is or he has. Here it means he has.
